intro: Haptocarpum bahiense, commonly known as the Brazilian burr bush, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible parts. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and clusters of small, greenish flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that produces hooked bracts, aiding in seed dispersal by attaching to animals. Haptocarpum bahiense is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
